noun.description: A fleshy filament growing from the mouth or snout of a fish.
A large European freshwater fish of the minnow family that has fleshy filaments hanging from its mouth. It lives in running water.
An African marine or freshwater fish with barbels around the mouth.

origin: Late Middle English (in barbel (sense 2)): via Old French from late Latin barbellus, diminutive of barbus barbel, from barba beard.
